title: Medical Assistant
description:
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

*(In compliance with the American with Disabilities Act, ADA, this description identifies the essential components of the job required to be performed with or without reasonable accommodations. Requests for reasonable accommodations to facilitate the performance of these essential functions will be given careful consideration.)*

**General Clinical Functions**

* Assist physicians with the following procedures and accurately documenting in Resource according to practice protocol:
	+ IUIs
	+ Ultrasounds (stim, pregnancy, 3D)
	+ Saline sonograms
	+ Post Op Exams
	+ Physical Exams
	+ Biopsies (cervical or endometrial polyps / retained POC)
	+ Catheter Removals
	+ Laminaria Insertions
	+ Cyst or Fluid aspiration
* Keep the physician on schedule by anticipating their needs and being available to assist.
* Perform and recorded height, weight and blood pressure for all new patients, follow up patients that have not had a BMI done within a year and if on a lab order and document according to protocol in Resource. DSD patients require height, weight, blood pressure, respiration rate, pulse and temperature to be performed and recorded.
* Obtain blood specimens and collect non-blood specimens for laboratory testing as ordered; use aseptic technique and in accordance with department procedures.
	+ Follow Practice policies & protocols when verifying, collecting, labeling and processing specimens.
	+ Write initials, date, time, all tubes used on copy of lab orders. Attach copies of all requisitions to the orders to be placed in file for up 3 months.
	+ Second Check test requisitions, type of tubes and labels for all orders processed prior to sending out. Initial, date and time all collections when second checked.
* Verbally ask then visually verify patient information prior to procedures and blood draws:
	+ Patients full name, date of birth, last 4 of social security if applicable. (For IUIs verifies both patient and partners name, date of birth and full social if any or the specimen information if using donor)
* + Confirm insurance with patient prior to drawing labs to ensure correct specimens are being collected. Make sure it is updated in resource prior to patient leaving
* Maintain safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations, and calling for assistance from other health care support personnel when appropriate.
* Protect patients and employees by adhering to infection-control policies and protocols.
* Ensure operation of equipment by following manufacturers instructions; advise manager when there are equipment problems or failures.
* Keep work area neat and clean; clean exam rooms promptly; clean sinks and counter tops in clinical areas.
* Restock daily supplies; advise Team Lead / Clinical Manager when stock needs replenishing; distribute clinical supplies as needed.
* Cooperate with office operations by assisting with the Physician team responsibilities as needed.

**Patient Interaction**

* Escort patients to and from phlebotomy area or examination rooms, and direct or escort patients to the front desk upon the completion of the patients clinical treatment.
* Comfort patients by anticipating patients anxieties; answering patients questions within the scope of the position; maintaining neat, clean examination rooms.
* Provide quality care by adhering to therapeutic standards; follow practice, physician and nursing division philosophies, as well as standards of care set by the state and other governing agency regulations.

**Teamwork**

* Consistently work in a positive and cooperative manner.
* Assist in the orientation/training of new team members when requested by manager.
* Assist other team members in the performance of their assignments.
* Consider the impact of your actions on team members throughout the Practice
* Seek out opportunities to help rather than waiting to be asked.
* Recognize the need for variations in staffing and volunteer to fill open shifts.
* Demonstrate flexibility to perform duties wherever volume deems it necessary within the Practice.
* Work weekends & holidays as needed and/or scheduled.
* Work various locations as needed and/or scheduled
* Work shifts starting as early as 6:45am and as late as 7:30pm. (Will be scheduled 1 or more days per week as needed for staffing)

**CONFIDENTIAL AND SENSITIVE INFORMATION:**

* Maintain patient confidence and protect operations by keeping all patient and proprietary information confidential.

**SCOPE OF FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY:**

* Participate in cost containment by appropriate use of medical and office supplies, and other budget requirements as communicated by practice management.

**ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITY:**

* Cooperate with office administration by filing medical records and other clinical documents.
* Understand Practice purchasing policies, including knowledge of vendors, instruments and supplies, as well as shipping and receiving procedures.
* Maintain daily, monthly, and yearly inventory for all clinical supplies and instruments.
* Maintain dating system for recall of supplies according to limit of shelf life.
* Process supply requests in a prompt, cooperative, and efficient manner.

**PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:**

* Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational in-service training and by attending staff meetings
* Completing online training as required.

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/PERFORMANCE FACTOR REQUIREMENTS:**

* High school diploma or equivalent and completion of Certified Medical Assistant Program required. State certification preferred.
* Entry level accepted; 6+ months experience in a physician practice preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology and rules required.
* Ability to access, input, and retrieves information from a computer.
* Knowledge of office procedure and office machines (i.e. computer, fax, copier, etc.).
* Ability to work as part of a multidisciplinary team.
* Ability to communicate accurately and concisely with excellent interpersonal skills.

**PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES**

**Interpersonal Skills**

* Is enthusiastic and maintains a positive attitude.
* Develops positive working relationships with colleagues, promoting team spirit.
* Uses tact and skill in confronting difficult interpersonal situations; avoids unnecessary conflict.
* Works well with diverse personalities
* Wins cooperation from others.

**Work Ethic**

* Exhibits honesty and integrity and develops trust.
* Volunteers for work when unassigned and makes productive use of unassigned time.
* Is a self-starter.
* Demonstrates a professional attitude and commitment that is an example to colleagues.
* Uses knowledge, experience, common sense and the highest ethical standards in dealing with sensitive situations.
* Follows through on commitments.
* Accepts share of less desirable assignments.

**Leadership**

* Demonstrates maturity, poise, and self-confidence in dealing with patients, physicians, management and staff.
* Is an effective role model.
* Takes responsibility for work product and demonstrates reliability.
* Communicates in a clear, confident, and effective manner.
* Deals effectively with stress and frustration.
* Earns respect of patients, physicians, management, and colleagues.
* Champions the mission and shared values through demonstrated action.
* Develops and is open to innovative ideas, approaches and viewpoints.
* Recognizes change as an opportunity to grow.
* Manages conflicting personal and professional requirements.
* Seeks opportunity to mentor colleagues as appropriate.

**Writing Skills**

* Memos/e-mails are concise, well organized, and include all significant issues.

**Speaking Skills**

* Exhibits confidence and willingness to effectively communicate with patients, physicians, management and colleagues.

**Presence**

* Demonstrates maturity, poise, and self-confidence.
* Earns the professional respect of others.
* Dress, neatness of grooming, etc, projects an image of a competent professional.
* Shows pride in and actively promotes its reputation, physicians and services.

**Initiative & Motivation**

* Acknowledges responsibility to ensure that assignments are satisfactorily completed.
* Demonstrates a personal commitment to her own professional development.
* Is a self-starter.
* Actively seeks out additional responsibilities.
* Persistent in overcoming obstacles.
* Responsive to formal and informal feedback.
* Is interested in opportunities within the Practice.
* Demonstrates energy, stamina, drive, and enthusiasm and is willing to work long hours when necessary.
* Understands own strengths and weaknesses and, with the help of others, undertakes a program of self-development.

**Teamwork**

* Strong team player with a positive attitude toward the job and work being performed.
* Wins cooperation from others.
* Shows integrity, honesty, openness, and tact in dealing with others.
* Is proactive in developing relationships within the department and with other departments.
* Places team before individual goals and contribute to a positive working environment.


Education and Experience:


Graduate of a Medical Assistant Program p

**ADDITIONAL JOB SPECIFICATIONS:**

**Physical Requirements:**

* Intermittent physical activity including walking, standing, sitting, lifting, and supporting patients. Grasping and feeling are necessary body movements.
* Sensory requirements of speech, touch, vision, and hearing to normal range, with or without correction.
* Requires manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination for easy and skillful use of hands when working with patients and equipment.

**Mental Requirements:**

* Must have the ability to perform concentrated and complex mental activity with frequent involvement in complex and highly technical situations.
* Must have the ability to work successfully under stressful conditions, and must be capable of adapting to varying workloads and work assignments on a frequent basis.
* Must have the ability to make sound, independent judgments based on scientific principles, and also be able to collaborate with other multidisciplinary team members in an appropriate fashion.
* Must have the ability to comprehend and perform oral and written instructions and procedures.
* Must have effective reading and comprehension skills.
* Must have strong communication skills, written and verbal to work with and/or care for people of all professional and social levels.

**Environmental Conditions:**

* Will work in an inside environment with temperature control.
* Occupational exposure to blood borne pathogens or other potentially infectious materials may reasonably be anticipated from the performance of patient care duties.
* Some physical hazards, i.e. needle pricks, etc.
* Some electrical hazards working with equipment. Some examples of equipment used are computer terminal, calculator, copy machine, fax machine, telephone, and patient care items requiring electricity.
* Weekends, late shifts, holidays and some overtime will be required.
* Work routines/schedules/locations are occasionally subject to change on short notice.

***All RMA LI IVF employees must perform their respective functions to ensure the patient has the most positive experience at every point of contact with our practice.***

***This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive statement of every duty and responsibility required by the jobholder. RMA LI IVF hopes each jobholder can react to reasonable change productively and handle other tasks assigned.***

***RMA LI IVF is a multi-site practice. There may be times you are requested to participate in assignments at other locations. Without causing undue hardship or significant personal inconvenience, RMA LI IVF proposes a solid team approach to our availability regarding the need and development of all our office locations.***

***This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an at will relationship.***

May substitute current clinical nursing school experience for per diem employment

Health care members and the community.

Expected to work assigned weekends, holidays and/or evenings to meet patient needs and schedule demands in growing clinical area. Must be available to work in any CARS office/location as assigned. Variable and as assigned. Flexibility needed based upon clinical and patient care needs. CARS is open 363 days per week.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
**Summary:** RMA Long Island IVF (LI IVF) is seeking a part time RN to meet the needs of its growing program. This is an excellent opportunity to work in a comprehensive state-of-the-art infertility treatment program which includes general clinical, in vitro fertilization (IVF), ambulatory surgery suite and/or third party reproduction.

**Essential duties and responsibilities:**

* Level 1 established-patient consultations
* Treatment cycle (OM, OI, IVF) coordination
	+ Screening checklist
	+ Patient orientation

	+ Calling with dosage instruction
* Phone and email triage
	+ Present urgent issues to physician
* Filling in for medical assistant when not available
	+ Phlebotomy
	+ Measuring vital signs
	+ Assist doctors with procedures
* New patient discharge

**Skills/qualifications:**

* Current valid RNlicense.

title: Software/Solution Sales Executive
description:
**100-120k base + uncapped commission** 

**Looking for exprience/skills in Software/Solution Sales in Financial Services** 

We are seeking Technology Sales Executive who can hit the ground running and help drive growth for new clients. This candidate will report to the EVP of Enterprise Technology Services and will have ownership of his or her deal cycles and quota. We are interested in candidates within traveling distance to one of our office locations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving technology services and solution-based sales, with a focus on financial services. This role requires excellent understanding of technology, strategic mindset, strong network of connections, excellent communication skills, and a track record of success in sales within the financial industry.

Responsibilities: Develop and Implement Sales Strategies: Identify and target potential BFSI clients and market segments for services, products, platforms and solution-based sales. Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve revenue targets and business objectives.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between sales efforts and service / solutions offerings and initiatives. Lead Generation and Prospecting: Generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting, networking, and lead generation activities.

Build and maintain a robust pipeline of qualified leads and opportunities.

Conduct market research to identify emerging trends (like Gen AI, CyberSecurity), customer needs, and competitive insights.

Client Engagement and Relationship Management: Cultivate strong relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders at prospective and existing client organizations. Understand client needs, pain points, and business challenges to tailor solutions that address their specific requirements.

Conduct technical solution demonstrations and presentations to showcase the value proposition of our offerings.

Sales Negotiation and Closure: Drive the sales process from initial contact through negotiation, contract signing, and close. Develop and present proposals, quotes, and pricing agreements that align with client expectations and company objectives. Negotiate terms and conditions to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes for both the client and the company.

Sales Reporting and Analysis: Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and deal status in Salesforce.

Generate regular reports and analytics to track sales performance, identify trends, and evaluate the effectiveness of sales strategies. Provide insights and recommendations for continuous improvement based on sales data analysis.

Qualifications: Proven track record of success in BFSI technology sales, Strong understanding of technology services and solution-based sales processes. Vast understanding of the financial services industry. Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.

Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with clients and internal stakeholders. Proficiency in Salesforce and Microsoft Office Suite. Willingness to travel as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Operations Manager
description:
Fix things, help others, and have fun! If you love saving the day, we have your dream troubleshooting job when you join the Operations team at Orangetheory Fitness!


**Who were looking for:**

**The Operations Managers** mission is operational excellence to ensure top quality and production in the studios they oversee. This includes handling all equipment, technology, and facility issues. This position requires the ability to develop strong relationships with outside vendors, create internal processes that can be replicated across the entire company, and stay within budget. This position also requires you to travel between the different locations you oversee. You are well organized, a problem-solver, and a producer.

**Why Join Us?**


* **Compensation:** $20.00 per hour plus commissions on membership sales
* **Career Growth:** Internal promotions are part of our culture! Blaze a trail into management roles and beyond! We're not just a brand; we're a launchpad for your career trajectory.
* **Benefits:** We offer medical, dental, and vision insurance. Secure your future with access to our 401(k) plan and earn $250 for every successful employee referral.
* **Work/Life Balance:** Put your mental well-being first with free counseling services. Find harmony between work and life as you enjoy exclusive employee discounts on Orangetheory classes, Relive Health services, and a plethora of entertainment and travel perks.
* **Community:** Join a tribe of like-minded individuals dedicated to making a difference. Forge lifelong connections with teammates and members, spreading positivity both in and out of the studio through community events and charitable initiatives.

**Role Responsibilities/Duties**


* Facility maintenance, issues, and repairs
* Maintain order and cleanliness of the studios
* Facility audits and walk-throughs
* Inventory levels and supplies for studio maintenance and/or marketing materials
* Retail purchasing and inventory
* Daily Financial Reporting (e.g., budget reconciliation, auditing refunds and unpaid bills etc.)
* IT, Technical and Facility updates
* Maintain and maximize working relationships with outside vendors to get the best deals
* Cross-trained on studio sales process and class check-in process to step in if necessary
* MBO audits (e.g., deactivating terminated members)
* Analyze current processes and look for improvements to maximize efficiency


Personal Attributes:

* Detail oriented and well organized
* Solution-oriented
* Multi-tasker with minimal supervision.
* On-call availability due to the possibility of facility or IT (Information Technology) issues needing to be resolved as soon as possible
* Proven flexibility and willingness to handle various tasks independently and to meet deadlines.

**Physical Demands:**

**T**he position requires the following physical activities: Ability to lift a minimum of 20 pounds to a maximum of 50 pounds unassisted; able to sit, stand, stoop, walk, stretch, reach frequently; moderate range of body motions. Physical requirements can vary. Reviewed my management.


**Qualifications:**

* Must have a High School diploma or equivalent. Bachelors degree preferred.
* 1-2 years of operations experience, ideally in a fitness setting.

**Our Mission:** To unlock your full potential through inspiring, motivating, and extraordinary moments.

**Vision: To** become the ultimate wellness powerhouse, fueling everyday life with boundless energy and vitality.

**Values: Happy**. Hungry. Humble. Healthy. Human.


**About Empire**


Established in 2013, Empire Portfolio Group is not just a company; it's a revolution. Headquartered in the vibrant heart of New York City, we own, operate, and support over 140 Orangetheory Fitness studios across multiple states. But we're not stopping there our sights are set on even greater heights with the introduction of Relive Health centers nationwide.

**Join the Movement**


Empire Portfolio Group is an equal opportunity employer, championing diversity and inclusion in every aspect of our operations. We believe in fostering an environment free from discrimination and harassment, where every individual has the opportunity to thrive. If you're ready to unleash your potential and make a difference, come soar with us


Ready to embark on this thrilling journey? Apply now and let's shape a brighter, healthier future together!

title: Per Diem Home Health Aide RN Instructor

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**About HeartShare**

For over 100 years, HeartShare has dedicated itself to improving the lives of people needing special services and support. The HeartShare team, now 2,100 employees and growing, helps individuals develop to their fullest potential and lead meaningful and enriched lives.


***We are looking for an overnight Part Time Direct Support Professional to work the overnight shift.***

***The schedule*** ***is 11 pm - 8 am Thursday - Saturday***

**Job Summary**  

What is a Direct Support Professional?  

The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for implementing person-centered services for each individual. This includes ensuring implementation of the individuals services, goals, and outcomes in relation to program-based and community inclusion activities. In addition, the Direct Support Professional is solely responsible for the individual's overall physical and emotional well-being.

**Job Responsibilities**


You will be responsible for:

* Under supervision, provide support and services which involve advocating for, encouraging, guiding, and teaching individuals in expressing personal choice, ensuring community integration, assisting individuals with personal hygiene care, toileting, lifts and transfers, dining, dressing, and meal preparation.
* You would help individuals to participate in games and recreational programs; coach and encourage individuals to develop daily living skills; and provide a clean, safe, and comfortable environment.
* You would collaborate with other staff to implement and record care plans and, in accordance with special instructions, you may administer medication. These positions are physically demanding.
* You would need to be prepared to act to ensure the health and safety of individuals in emergency situations.
* You will participate in staff meetings, in-service training and on-site workshops as required for professional growth and development. Attending external training and workshops in the direction of direct supervisor or program management. Maintain certification in \\*AMAP, CPR, First Aid and SCIP, as required. \\*Note: Failure to maintain AMAP certification can result in removal of full-time employee status.
* You must be able to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stretch, and lift bedridden and/or incapacitated individuals.
* You will help to promote and support the inclusion of individuals in their community according to their unique needs, interests, and desires. Model and encourage interaction between individuals and community members. Help foster individuals personal growth by assisting in forming and maintaining friendships with neighbors, co-workers, and peers.
* You will help with transporting individuals or assist them in taking public transportation.
* You will assist in maintaining positive communications with family members, advocates, and service providers as per program needs.


To learn more about what direct support professionals do on the job every day, go to http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cnK4z3KAqtE.

**Qualifications**  

You are a good fit if you have:  

High school diploma, GED, CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant certification) or possess a Direct Support Professional (DSP) certificate from an accredited public or private organization.  

One year or more work experience with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.  

Excellent written, communication and mathematical skills.  

Valid NYS driver license preferred but not required.  

A flexible work schedule.

**Benefits**  

What we offer once YOU join our growing family:

  

At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.

title: Usher
company: Madison Square Garden Entertainment and Sports
description:
Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp. (MSG Entertainment) is a leader in live entertainment, delivering unforgettable experiences while forging deep connections with diverse and passionate audiences. The Company's portfolio includes a collection of world-renowned venues – New York's Madison Square Garden, The Theater at Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall, and Beacon Theatre; and The Chicago Theatre – that showcase a broad array of sporting events, concerts, family shows, and special events for millions of guests annually. In addition, the Company features the original production, the Christmas Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes, which has been a holiday tradition for 90 years. More information is available at www.msgentertainment.com.

**Who are we hiring?**

The Beacon Theatre Usher is responsible for greeting and escorting patrons to seats in an efficient and professional manner.


**What will you do?**

* Check tear or scan patron's tickets.
* Welcome guests to the event, provide guest service and answer questions as requested.
* Check aisles prior to the house open to ensure cleanliness of aisles and seating areas.
* Provide information to patrons and answer questions/inquiries regarding Radio City Music Hall facility.
* Be a problem solver with patron incidents.
* Ensure that the rules and regulations of Radio City Music Hall are being adhered to.
* Operate the elevator in the theatre.
* Will assist the Merchandise department with stocking, making popcorn, etc.
* Must be willing to rotate to various positions within a shift, not limited to working Private events.


**What do you need to succeed?**


* The ideal candidate will have strong communication, customer service and problem-solving skills.
* Aid guests with disabilities by providing wheelchair escorts and partnering with the Disabled Services group as necessary.
* Must be able to solve guest issues and handle stressful situations in a timely manner.
* Ensure that the rules and regulations of Radio City Music Hall are being adhered to.
* Must be comfortable operating an elevator/ must be comfortable with heights.


**Special Requirements**


* Must be receptive to working outside in inclement weather and extreme temperatures.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.
* Ability to stand and move about the theater throughout the duration of the shift.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, have split days off, work weekends and holidays in a 24 X 7 environment


#LI-Onsite


At MSG, we recognize the importance of upskilling employees' talents and strengths so they can drive their careers forward. We are proud to offer a robust set of tools and resources to help employees understand their interests and purpose, harness their talents and obtain the skills they need to reach the next step in their careers. Growth and longevity for our employees are top priorities here.



We value diversity and are looking for extraordinary employees of all backgrounds! MSG is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, citizenship, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law mandates, MSG complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in all locations and will consider requests for reasonable accommodations as required.

title: Patient Services Representative - Front Desk - Russian Speaking - Brighton Beach, NY
description:
**SUMMARY:**



As a Patient Services Representative, you will play a crucial role in ensuring seamless patient experiences across multiple practices and facilities. Your responsibilities will include patient registration, appointment scheduling, and triaging clinical calls. This position is vital to maintaining efficient operations and delivering exceptional patient care.


**Salary: $20 an hour**


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**



To successfully perform this role, you must be able to execute each essential function with or without reasonable accommodations:


* **Patient Interaction:** Greet patients with a professional and welcoming demeanor. Handle patient registration and schedule appointments efficiently.
* **Clinical Call Management:** Triage and route clinical calls to the appropriate channels, ensuring timely and accurate responses.
* **Documentation Support:** Assist patients in completing necessary paperwork, providing clear instructions and support as needed.
* **Facility Maintenance:** Ensure the work area and lobby are kept clean, organized, and presentable at all times.
* **Issue Resolution:** Escalate any patient inquiries or issues to the appropriate resources promptly to ensure a high standard of service.
* **Productivity & Compliance:** Meet or exceed departmental productivity standards while maintaining a strong understanding of billing processes and medical services offered by practitioners.
* **Referral Management:** Accurately enter referral information into the system and manage patient records, including filing and retrieving medical charts as necessary.
* **Dependability:** Demonstrate regular and reliable attendance to support consistent patient care.
* **Additional Duties:** Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent.
* **Experience:** 0-1 year of customer service experience in a call center, healthcare, or retail environment.
* **Skills:** Proficient in collecting patient payments at the time of service. Computer literate with the ability to navigate multiple systems simultaneously. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
* Must be able to speak Russian/English


**PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS:**



The physical and mental demands listed below are essential to performing the key responsibilities of this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities:


* **Physical Activity:** This role occasionally requires standing, walking, and sitting for extended periods. The use of hands for tasks such as handling objects, operating tools, or typing is frequent. Occasionally, you may need to climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The ability to lift, push, pull, and move up to 20 pounds is required. Repetitive upper body motion is necessary for extended computer use.
* **Vision Requirements:** Close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus are necessary for this role.


**WORK ENVIRONMENT & TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:**


* **Work Environment:** The role is primarily based in a well-lit, ventilated, and climate-controlled office environment, equipped with standard office and medical clinic equipment. Some equipment may have moving mechanical parts.
* **Noise Level:** The noise level in the work environment is typical of an office or medical clinic setting.
* **Travel Requirements:** This position does not typically require travel.


**NOTE:** This job description is not exhaustive and may be updated or modified by the department supervisor as required to meet evolving operational needs.

title: Food Handler/Server
description:
**About Us**  

At Muse Paintbar, we blend the creativity of art with the joy of entertainment to craft an unforgettable experience for our guests. Our unique space showcases an alluring and lively artistic experience, paired with a selection of crowd-pleasing food and beverage offerings, including a curated beer and wine bar. Dedicated to fostering a community of talent and art enthusiasts, we invite individuals to join our dynamic team, creating a place full of creativity, collaboration, and growth opportunities for our customers and team members.

 **About You**  

You are a multi-talented team player, adept in both food preparation and guest service. Your exceptional time management and customer service skills enable you to prepare and deliver food efficiently while engaging positively with our guests. Your versatility shines as you seamlessly transition between preparing food and serving, creating memorable experiences for our patrons.

 **The Role**  

As a **Food Handler/Server**, you play a dual role in our team. Primarily, you'll be responsible for heating and preparing high-quality food in our kitchen, focusing on presentation and safety. Additionally, you'll engage directly with customers as a server and cashier, providing top-notch service at the bar and tableside.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Food Handling and Presentation:** Skillfully prepare and serve food orders, prioritizing quality, visual appeal, and safety to enhance customer satisfaction.
* **Kitchen Operations and Safety:** Adhere to the kitchen checklist, ensuring a clean and safe environment while diligently monitoring kitchen equipment and maintaining safety standards.
* **Direct Customer Interaction:** Engage with customers while serving as a cashier and server, delivering food and drinks, and ensuring a positive experience.
* **Food and Beverage Service:** Provide knowledgeable recommendations and serve food and beverages, including alcoholic drinks, with a focus on driving sales and customer satisfaction.
* **Session Support:** Contribute to the session's success by greeting customers, assisting with their needs, and maintaining the studio's readiness for sessions.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work flexibly with the team, sharing responsibilities to ensure the best customer experience and attending team meetings for continuous improvement.

 **Shift Requirements**

* Part-time availability, averaging 15-25 hours per week.
* Flexibility to work varied hours, including days, evenings, and weekends.

 **Required Skills and Abilities**

* Strong culinary skills with a focus on food presentation and safety.
* Strong communication skills, punctuality, and a focus on customer service excellence.
* Understanding of Muse Paintbar's market, products, and services.
* Tech-savviness with kitchen appliances and general technology.
* Reliable transportation and willingness to travel when required.

 **Experience and Education**

* At least 1 year of experience in a kitchen, restaurant, or bar environment.
* Interest or background in the arts preferred.
* Alcohol Safety/TIPS and ServSafe Certifications (provided by Muse if needed).

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to stand for extended periods and lift up to 50 pounds at times.
* Ability to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.

*The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or physical requirements. Nothing in this job description restricts managements right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job at any time. Muse Paintbar will provide reasonable accommodations to enable individuals to perform their essential job duties consistent with applicable law.*


Muse Paintbar is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion and diversity. As a proud equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, mental or physical disability, military or veteran status, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Marketing Manager I
description:
We are currently seeking a creative, results-driven Marketing Manager with a strong understanding of private capital markets to join our Financial Advisory team supporting our Private Capital Markets (PCM) digital platforms.  



Based in our New York or Morristown, or Chicago office as part of our global marketing team, the Manager will partner with key business stakeholders to create and deploy global marketing campaigns.  



This marketer will own the marketing strategy for high-profile Private Capital Markets services, including the Valuation Platform and Valuation Benchmarks, crafting messaging and campaign tactics to support revenue growth and client acquisition. The PCM manager will develop lead generation programs across channels to identify new customers and increase the PCM sales funnel. The individual will also coordinate all social messaging for the PCM business and partner with Kroll’s corporate social team to align strategy and best practices. The prospective candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of business marketing experience in the professional services sector and exceptional writing skills.  



Note: This position will be Hybrid from one of the following offices: New York, Morristown or Chicago  



Our New York office is moving to the World Trade Center.  



Day-to-day responsibilities:
* Serve as the marketing lead for Kroll’s Private Capital Markets digital platforms. Collaborate with practice leaders to develop world-class marketing campaigns, collateral, and thought leadership that elevates the business and drives growth for core areas:
	+ Valuation Platform: A cloud-native portfolio analytics and data management platform for the private capital markets. It enhances investment workflows, allowing teams to monitor portfolios, automate valuations, and benchmark performance.
	+ Valuation Benchmarks: Offers the most comprehensive view of private credit’s middle market, allowing asset managers and investors to gain insights into their investments and make informed decisions with confidence.
* Lead social media efforts for Kroll’s Private Capital Markets digital platforms, enhancing key messages and coordinating the publishing calendar with Kroll’s social media team.
* Work with business leads to align product marketing strategy with sales and customer goals.
* Partner with business marketing colleagues to find cross-service opportunities to promote the PCM product suite.
* Ensure all marketing efforts are in compliance with regulatory and Kroll brand guidelines.
* Support select Kroll regional markets with creative, targeted marketing and thought leadership efforts.
* Collaborate with select Kroll industry experts to enhance thought leadership through innovative lead-generation campaigns.
* Demonstrate technical expertise in the development and execution of global internal email campaigns.
* Assist with maintaining the marketing budget by submitting invoices, tracking expenditures, and reconciliation.
* Leverage Kroll’s proprietary campaign metrics tools to create performance dashboards, distributed to key stakeholders as regular performance updates on marketing and social campaigns.
* Monitor financial industry trends and news, suggesting thought leadership that elevates client conversations.
* Work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment to ensure proper comprehensive external and internal marketing material updates.
* Enforce the Kroll communications guidelines across all marketing and communication materials.
* Work autonomously, as well as within teams, depending on the project.

  



Essential traits:
* Minimum of 5 years of business marketing experience in the professional services sector.
* Superb written, copy editing, and oral communication skills.
* Strong understanding of private capital markets, including different asset classes.
* Ability to read and analyze financial statements.
* Up-to-date knowledge of current trends in the financial markets.
* Proficient in SEO and SEM best practices.
* Strong marketing operations, presentation, analytics, and other general digital skills (PowerPoint, Tableau, Microsoft suite, Google Suite, Eloqua, Salesforce marketing cloud/social studio, etc.)
* Strong project management skills.
* Thorough understanding of the rules governing the grammar and usage of the English language as well as familiarity with standard reference texts. Familiarity with AP style is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Time management and prioritization skills, ability to work well under pressure.
* Strong interpersonal skills, a team player capable of collaborating across a global organization.
* Knowledge of how to use productivity tools including Monday.com is a plus.
* Strong sense of humor is especially welcome.

  



About Kroll  



Join the global leader in risk and financial advisory solutions—Kroll. With a nearly century-long legacy, we blend trusted expertise with cutting-edge technology to navigate and redefine industry complexities. As a part of One Team, One Kroll, you'll contribute to a collaborative and empowering environment, propelling your career to new heights. Ready to build, protect, restore and maximize our clients’ value? Your journey begins with Kroll.  



In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.  


*Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.*  

The current salary range for this position is $60,000 to $150,000  



#LI-FD1

title: Director of Media and Communications
description:
The office of the Deputy Speaker of the New York City Council is seeking is seeking a Director of Media and Communications to serve as the connector to our constituents via newsletters, social media outlets and written communications.

**SALARY RANGE:**

$70,000 to $70,000

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

· Create and curate media and communications products, including photography, video, flyers/posters and social media content.

· Draft statements, quotes and official correspondence for review.

· Manage our social media pages and website.

· Create Bi-weekly and monthly newsletters.

· Conduct press outreach and provide timely responses to press inquiries.

· Demonstrate flexibility in addressing emerging and or unanticipated challenges, events or opportunities.

· Ability to staff Council Member to in-person events to capture photos and videos.

· Prepare Council Member for interviews and speaking engagements.

· Keep a pulse on district related issues and create a structure to communicate important trends to the Council Member.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

· Exceptional oral and written communication skills.

· Highly organized and careful attention to detail.

· An interest in local government, politics, and city issues.

· Experience building and maintaining relationships with diverse communities.

· Ability to multitask and manage projects from inception to conclusion.

· Good judgment and political sensitivity.

· Ability to set and meet internal and external deadlines, work in a fast-paced government office, and work both independently and within a team.

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**

New York City residency required within 90 days of appointment.

For eligible employees, health, dental and vision insurance coverage are offered upon hire. Retirement plans also available.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Project Manager
description:
The Project Manager will define, scope, and manage large, complex projects while working with senior management to ensure business objectives are achieved. This position will be hybrid in our New York office located at the World Trade Center.  



Day-to-day responsibilities:
* Direct project management of a large-scale, or series or mid-scale, complex project(s) that will involve multiple internal and external stakeholders
* Adherence to the Change Framework, ensuring quality of project reporting via Kroll deployed program management tools.
* Develop the project charter, integrated project plan, resource plan, contingency plan, and related project management artefacts.
* Evaluate trade-offs between project size and complexity, cost, urgency, risk, and stakeholder value
* Manage detailed plans across the critical path to deliverance of project objectives, engaging with stakeholders and critically assessing requirements
* Anticipate issues and delays, and evaluate trade-offs between project size and complexity, cost, urgency, risk, and stakeholder value, effectively assessing and resolving high priority project risks.
* Define and report on project progress and achievement of project milestones, regularly updating key and senior stakeholders on project status.
* Continually manage project dependencies, ensuring smooth and timely delivery of the key milestones
* Identify areas for methodological improvement and implements changes.
* Validate, track and forecast financial forecasts and provide on-going reconciliation of project expenditures and key financial metrics against targets, applying insights from the business to make recommendations to effectively manage budget.
* Partner with business sponsors to define success metrics and criteria
* Build, lead, and coach project teams throughout project lifecycles
* Facilitate all operational checkpoint activities throughout the lifecycle of projects
* Assess and resolve all high priority project risks as they are encountered
* Continually update relevant business stakeholders of project status and periodically publish project status reports
* Responsible for facilitating and chairing regular project meetings, and follow-up with project team members as required including the preparation, collation, and distribution of project status reports, ad hoc presentations, and reporting (including executive and senior management reporting).

  



Essential traits:
* More than 5 years of experience and knowledge of large scale, global, change program and portfolio management
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and the proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels
* Excellent at managing and influencing a wide network of stakeholders, including senior management, who can influence and build relationships
* Strong planning, organizational, and coaching skills
* Willing and able to challenge customers and stakeholders to better understand their needs
* Expert knowledge of financial management, risk, and project management methodologies
* Excellent documentation skills; ability to create high quality steering committee materials
* Background in working across a number of different sectors both business and IT related projects/programs
* Ability to support the creation of a high-performance culture within a business change context.
* Ability to hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and deliver required business outcomes.
* Ability to deal with ambiguity.
* Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
* Influences and resolves complex requirements challenges across the organization.
* Ability to work in a dynamic matrix environment and influence groups outside of immediate organization to execute efficiently

  



About Kroll  



Join the global leader in risk and financial advisory solutions—Kroll. With a nearly century-long legacy, we blend trusted expertise with cutting-edge technology to navigate and redefine industry complexities. As a part of One Team, One Kroll, you'll contribute to a collaborative and empowering environment, propelling your career to new heights. description:
**Job Title**


Cleaning Person**Job Description Summary**


Responsible for keeping offices, hallways, stairs, and other areas within the building in clean and orderly condition by performing basic cleaning duties. May also perform clean-up and basic maintenance of the surrounding grounds and premises. Performs other related cleaning, basic maintenance and incidental duties as assigned.**Job Description**


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES  

  

* Daily interior cleaning of the building including emptying waste receptacles, debris and trash removal, vacuuming/shampooing floors and carpets, dusting and cleaning furniture, cleaning and restocking restrooms, washing walls, polishing, mopping floors, placing down mats/runners in inclement weather, cleaning up spills, cleaning windows and window coverings, etc., in accordance with established procedures and as directed by a Supervisor
* May be required to perform exterior building and premises cleaning and basic maintenance, including exterior walls and windows, parking lots and structures, walk ways and paths, gardens and lawns, outdoor furnishings, pools/ fountains/ spas, curbs/gutters, exterior hallways and stairwells, etc.
* May be directed to assist with minor maintenance and repair work, including painting, replacement of light bulbs and fixtures (interior and exterior), replacement of windows, moving furniture and equipment, repairing doors and gates, minor landscaping and related upkeep and repairs, and simple plumbing and fixture repairs/replacements
* Other assigned duties (depending on the building, facility, and client needs) may include gardening and lawn care, assisting with inventory control and supply ordering, snow removal (including salting/ sanding), and assisting with tenant moves
* Expected to promptly notify management of spills and emergency situations, need for major and minor building/facility repairs, lights that are out or broken, broken equipment and fixtures, damaged structures, ruptured pipes/plumbing, problems with heating/cooling and ventilation and any other observable safety issues/concerns
* Expected to properly and safely use and operate related equipment, tools, devices, and chemical/cleaning agents, including mops, vacuums, electric polishing machines, power tools and equipment, and special cleaning solutions in order to efficiently perform the duties and to avoid harming floors, fixtures, individuals, and themselves


KEY COMPETENCIES  

1. Organization Skills  

2. Flexibility  

3. Detail Oriented  

4. Thoroughness  

5. Results Oriented  

IMPORTANT EDUCATION  

* High school diploma or GED is preferred

  

IMPORTANT EXPERIENCE  

* Some cleaning experience and basic mechanical knowledge is preferred

  

ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY QUALIFICATIONS  

* Follows both oral and written instructions
* Follows through and carries out work orders
* Reliable, thorough, observant, organized, flexible and courteous

  

WORK ENVIRONMENT  

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Regularly required to travel outside between properties in varying weather conditions.  

  

PHYSICAL DEMANDS  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  

* Must have ability to stoop, stand, climb, frequently lift a minimum of 50 lbs. of equipment (pumps, tools, ladders) and safely install rigging/lifting devices
* Regularly required to crouch and reach to install/move equipment by bending forward at the waist or by bending legs and spine
* Involves movement between departments, floors, and properties to facilitate work
* Ability to speak clearly so others can understand you
* Ability to read and understand information presented orally and in writing
* Regularly required to utilize vision abilities, allowing reading of printed material, drawings, and schematics

title: Vice President, Global Communications
description:
The Vice President of Communications for the Financial Advisory business is a key member of Kroll’s corporate communications team and will be located in our New York office.  



This role will serve as the communications lead for Kroll’s Financial Advisory business, partnering closely with the executives in charge of Financial Advisory and their management team to create compelling, timely and firm-aligned content for all of their internal/external needs. Central to that effort will be developing and executing intra-Financial Advisory business communication strategies, aligned with the overall firm strategies, to foster a strong sense of culture and cohesion within Financial Advisory, and to support transformation in line with the firm’s business and employee engagement goals.  

The portfolio of responsibilities of the Vice President, Financial Advisory Communications comprises all internal BAU (business-as-usual) communications for the Financial Advisory business and it’s executive committee members. This includes, for example, but is not limited to: town halls, slides, fireside chats, videocasts, memos and blogs, etc. across all internal channels (such as email, intranet, phone, Slack/MS Teams, etc.). In close collaboration with our external communications team, this role is also responsible for the external presence of the FA executives across social media, media and speaking engagements.  



This role reports to the Global Head of Corporate Communications.  



Note: This position is located in our New York office.  



Day-to-day responsibilities:
* Amplifying firmwide internal communications projects for the Financial Advisory business, working closely with the Global Head of Corporate Communications, the leads for Financial Advisory, Transformation, and HR communications
* Working in a high volume, fast-paced environment delivering internal communications projects and driving external strategy for the Financial Advisory business
* Executing strategic initiatives, both proactive and reactive short-term and long-term campaigns, that are specific to the Financial Advisory business.
* Counseling the executives who head the Financial Advisory business on strategic communications plans and providing them with executive writing support
* Planning and writing Financial Advisory business content for a variety of internal communications channels, including leadership presentations, newsletters, key messages / scripts, speeches, video and other creative assets, among other work products
* Developing and delivering an external profile for FA executives, including social media, external presentations at appropriate conferences and press in close partnership and collaboration with the global head of Corporate Communications
* Acting as a thought partner to the firm’s other communications leads, surfacing ideas for potential pieces and opportunities to showcase cutting edge practices and ideas emanating from Financial Advisory business

  



Essential traits:
* A bachelor’s degree in communications, Marketing, or a related field
* A minimum of 5-7 years of experience in: developing internal & external communications, supporting executives, creating and deploying impactful messaging and core materials, developing multi-channel programming to support employee engagement, business priorities, culture, and a track record of delivering solid, measurable results
* Excellent writing, copyediting and communication skills; experience managing communications across a suite of channels, including the intranet, live webcast, newsletters, digital signage, Slack/MS teams etc.
* Well-developed and professional interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels
* Experience with social media, media and external profile raising
* Experience working in a fast-paced, high-volume environment, managing multiple projects across different stakeholders; agency experience a plus
* Strong experience with MS PowerPoint, SharePoint

  



About Kroll  



Join the global leader in risk and financial advisory solutions—Kroll. With a nearly century-long legacy, we blend trusted expertise with cutting-edge technology to navigate and redefine industry complexities. As a part of One Team, One Kroll, you'll contribute to a collaborative and empowering environment, propelling your career to new heights. Ready to build, protect, restore and maximize our clients’ value? Your journey begins with Kroll.  



In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.  


*Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.*  

The current salary range for this position is $70,000 to $200,000

title: Regional Home Care Recruiter

description:
Job description

Premier Home Health Care Services, Inc. is a leading established Home Health Care Agency.

We currently have an opportunity for a Regional Home Care Recruiter to support the Nassau and Suffolk regions. Candidate must be able to travel to our New York office for meetings.

The role of the home care recruiter is to source and attract candidates to deliver personal care and home health aide services to our clients. The home care recruiter is responsible for screening caregivers who align with Premier’s mission and values, ensuring exceptional care for our clients. This role is field-based, requiring active engagement with potential candidates in the office at varying external locations, including healthcare facilities and recruitment events.

Key Functions:

* Participate in regular field recruiting/hiring events, job fairs, and street fairs to attract HHAs to the company; ensuring we are competitive in the industry to attract applicants.
* Review, analyze, and ensure fulfillment of staffing needs for our recruiting teams.
* Make connections with Home Health Aide Schools and develop presentations to the staff as well as the students of HHA schools, programs, and caregiver application programs.

title: Bike Repair Technician
description:
Are you an enthusiastic bike mechanic with a passion for quality work? If so, join Lawton's Service Company in Hightstown, NJ for an opportunity like no other. We are seeking a skilled **full- or part-time Bike Repair Technician** to be part of our dynamic auto repair team. With a competitive salary range of **$18 to $30 per hour**, alongside benefits, this is your chance to take your bike mechanic career to new heights. We offer **great benefits and perks** such as:

* Uniforms
* Continuing education
* Health benefits
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Sick time
* Top-of-the-line electrical diagnostic equipment
* A clean and comfortable work environment

 **YOUR ROLE AS A BIKE REPAIR TECHNICIAN**


As an integral part of our team, your day will be filled with diverse and fulfilling tasks, including diagnostics, component removal and replacement, and ensuring the top condition of our customers' bikes. Benefit from a well-organized environment that thrives on teamwork and mutual support, all while working with the latest state-of-the-art equipment to deliver exceptional service to our customers.

 **YOUR SCHEDULE**


This full- or part-time position in Hightstown, NJ provides a consistent work schedule between **8 am to 5 pm**, allowing you to achieve work-life balance without compromising on your passion for bike mechanics.

 **REQUIREMENTS**

* Some mechanical schooling
* Strong eye for detail and an organized approach to your work
* Ability to work effectively within a team
* Own your own tools

 **OUR MISSION**


For over 25 years, we have been catering to a diverse range of customer automotive needs through our two specialized companies, LSC Mechanical and Lawton's Service Company. LSC Mechanical is our consumer auto repair shop, ensuring exceptional service for general vehicle maintenance and towing needs. Lawton's Service Company is our more experienced division, focusing on larger vehicles and machinery. Our motto, "Give us a call, we do it all," perfectly reflects our versatile approach and ability to handle whatever comes our way.


Our work environment is similar to that of a dealership - clean, organized, and professional. Management is respectful and fosters open, easy communication between team members. Joining us means being in an environment where you can focus and complete your best work without unnecessary distractions.

 **READY TO APPLY?**


If you're ready to embark on an exciting auto repair career as a full- or part-time Bike Repair Technician at Lawton's Service Company, waste no time and apply now! Our mobile-friendly, 3-minute application initial process is designed to swiftly bring talented individuals like you on board.

title: Director, Business Development, Kroll Settlement Administration

title: General Dentist
description:
Eastern Dental has been providing families with full-service dental care for over 40 years. From children to seniors, our skilled team of dentists and specialists provide the highest level of dental care to ensure healthy and happy smiles. If you are caring, compassionate and have a true desire to help others, becoming a member of the Eastern Dental Family may be the perfect opportunity for you.


We are seeking a patient focused Dentist to care for our patients in our established, multi-specialty practice, utilizing a comprehensive approach to full-service dentistry.

**This is a part time position**


We welcome those with a strong focus on quality, service and patient satisfaction.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Diagnose and treat patients with oral diseases
* Provide General Dentistry treatment and services to patients with clinically sound and compassionate care.
* Educate patients about oral hygiene and preventive dental care
* Monitor patient progress and maintain treatment records
* Ensure in compliance regulatory agencies, and dental board procedures
* Work with staff to provide quality patient care services
* Address clinical issues promptly and accurately
* Show dedication and provide the highest quality of care to patients

**Benefits of working for Eastern Dental:**

* Guaranteed daily rate plus uncapped earning potential

* Continuing Education Course allowance
* Work location & hours flexibility
* Medical Benefits, Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay

* DDS / DMD degree and at least 1 year of work experience in a U.S Dental Practice or completed General Practice Residency
* Relevant State Dental License active in good standing
* Ability to be credentialed with insurances and governmental insurance programs.
* Excellent communication skills
* Proficient in performing regular checkups and dental procedures
* Required skills include critical thinking, decision making, active listening, complex problem solving
* The ability to deliver a caring and supportive environment to patients

title: Store Visual Manager
description:
**Job Description** **Overall Job Summary:** The Store Visual Manager is responsible for supporting the Sales and Profit goals in the store by setting a plan to deliver the Best Customer Experience. The Store Visual Manager will ensure the store has the Best Team and support their development, as well as working with succession planning, talent development, and structured performance management for the team based on results, values, and leadership. The Store Visual Manager will work in accordance with legal requirements and H&M standards, policies, and procedures to meet the expectations of customers and colleagues.


This position reports to the Store Manager and has the following direct reports: Visual Merchandisers Key & Visual Merchandisers

 **Your Day to Day\\***


Sales and profit


A Store Visual Manager will ensure that the garment presentation in windows and in-store is according to the Commercial Handbook. Together with the Store Manager, the Store Visual Manager will lead the team to maximize and drive the Commercial opportunities within the H&M brand guidelines. The Store Visual Manager will follow-up and analyze key KPI’s and initiate actions to increase profit and support the commercial planning of the store. The role will ensure that all safety, security, and administration procedures are followed.

  

Fashion Knowledge

* Ensure you are up to date with current fashion trends
* Share, inspire and educate the store team on seasonal trend information, upcoming campaigns, and brand standards


Direct Customer Service

* Ensure you meet customer expectations on direct service according to H&M standards
* Support the store to achieve excellent customer service


Indirect Customer Service

* Ensure the visual team follow up on the Visual Identity through the implementation of the Commercial handbook and secure well-styled mannequins in windows and in-store.
* Guarantee the team creates a clear red threat from windows to A-area with wearable buying suggestions
* Lead the store team to secure high quality, commercial garment presentation and care
* Maintain clear customer flow through fixture placement and navigation in line with H&M standards
* Ensure the launch and maintenance of all sales campaigns and activities are on time according to H&M standards and optimized for the store


Drive Sales Targets

* Ensure the store commerciality can compete effectively in the local market by identifying opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and selling
* Follow up, evaluate, and give feedback on sales KPIs to the management team
* Initiate changes to improve the business together with the Store Manager


Visual Store Operational Routines

* Ensure the team secures Sample picking to create clear stories and wearable buying suggestions
* Follow Best Practice on quantity, condition, and maintenance for all Visual Merchandiser material, props, and marketing material with a sustainability mindset.
* Keep visual room organized and safe
* Keep all Visual materials in the store current and share information with the team on seasonal changes.


Analysis

* Stay updated on products and sales activities
* Set store visual goals with the Store Manager; facilitate them and do follow ups
* Plan and prioritize commercial workload according to business needs and budget

  

People and Teams


By managing the Visual team, the Store Visual Manager will support and lead the entire Store team to increase the shopping and working experience in the store. The role will ensure all employee relation responsibilities, legal requirements, and H&M policies are fulfilled. The role will work to make the Visual lifecycle a reality for all members of the Visual team.


Training and Development

* Evaluate & develop the visual and commercial skills of the store team through regular visual training for all colleagues to support garment presentation in line with the Commercial Handbook
* Ensure succession planning within the store Visual team with Area Visual
* Execute and ensure store Visual recruitment with Store Manager
* Support the Country and Area with expansion needs


Security

* Promote employee and customer safety
* Resolve health & safety, legal, and security issues
* Address any loss prevention and safety issues that may occur while on duty and bring any escalated employee issues to the management team

  

Communication and Legal Requirements

* Ensure that all communication in the windows and sales floor meet local legislation
* Update store team on business performance, new initiatives, and other relevant issues

  

Financial Accountability

* None

  

**Qualifications** **Who You Are**

* Inclusive, positive, creative, and willing to learn on the job!
* Passionate for customer service and helping people find their style
* A multi-tasker who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment with an eye for detail
* Ability to coach and counsel staff on performance management and progressive discipline techniques
* 1-2+ years of transferrable experience welcome
* You have the ability to lift in excess of 20 pounds
* Ability to stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance
* Ability to climb a ladder and use a step stool
* Must be able to work with hand and power operated tools (Iron, Steamer, etc) and lift in order to execute display setups
* Must be able to work a flexible work schedule, including nights and weekends
* May be required to travel to support other stores

 **Why You’ll Love Working for H&M**

* Dynamic, team-driven work environment with a group of unique, diverse, and kind individuals.
* Endless growth & development opportunities.
* Dress your personality. We encourage you to dress your personality all day, every day.
* Did we mention our discount at H&M, &Other Stories, and COS?

  

**Additional Information** **Job Status:** Hourly, Non-Exempt

**Compensation**: Hiring Range is $25.40 - 28.58 Hourly\\*\\*

**EEOC Code:** SLS

* This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties and responsibilities assigned for this job at the company’s discretion.


\\*\\*H&M, in good faith, believes that this posted range of compensation is the accurate range for this role at this location at the time of this posting. H&M may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range depending on candidate qualifications. This range may be modified in the future.

**Benefits:**

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*

*We offer: 25% Staff Discount - Medical, Pharmacy Vision and Dental Coverage – Employee Assistance Program - Vacation, Wellness, Holiday and Parental Pay – 401K – Commuter Benefits, Health and Dependent Care FSA. Plus, additional Voluntary Benefits.*

**Inclusion & Diversity:**

*H&M**is a part of H&M Group. title: Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions
description:
We are looking for an Analyst to join our leading Consumer practice within the Mergers & Acquisitions Service Line. We are looking for talented and motivated individuals to grow with the practice.  



Our Consumer M&A service line assists middle-market companies and is differentiated by industry expertise and superior deal execution. At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll.  



Day-to-day responsibilities:
* Gather and synthesize industry information from research sources including the Internet, trade publications, industry and equity analyst reports, and periodicals
* Perform financial analyses on client companies, including comparable transaction and public company analysis
* Use research and financial analysis to draft executive summaries, information memorandums and other marketing documents
* Research and develop potential buyer, investor, and other target lists
* Manage transaction logistics, including: Update web-based deal and contact management systems, develop weekly client status reports, administer electronic data rooms, presentation binding, and so forth.

  



Essential traits:
* Completed Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Management (with a concentration in Finance) or Economics from an Accredited University or College with a minimum of 1 year of financially focused work experience (investment banking experience preferred)
* Demonstrated track record of superior academic and work performance; demonstrated commitment to outstanding results
* Strong analytical, comprehension and problem- solving skills, as well as strong verbal and written communication skills
* Demonstrates an understanding of financial statement analysis, the merger & acquisition process, and company valuation techniques (discounted cash flow analysis, public company multiples, transaction multiples)
* Ability to master new tasks quickly
* Proven business research skills
* Active Series 79 and 63 licenses
* Dedication to teamwork, demonstrated leadership experience and strong personal integrity
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, with focus on Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
* Ability to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments and manage rapidly changing assignments in a team environment
* Flexibility to travel, as needed

title: IT Support Analyst - 2nd shift (Contract)
description:
**Company Information**



Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy.



Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen, one of the pharmaceutical companies of Johnson & Johnson, to jointly develop and commercialize ciltacabtagene autolecuel (cilta-cel) in 2017. Our strategic partnership is designed to combine the strengths and expertise of both companies to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma.



Legend Biotech is seeking an **IT Support Analyst - 2nd shift (Contract)** as part of the **US IT** team based in **Raritan, NJ.**


**Role Overview**



The IT Support Analyst is a dynamic role that bridges the gap between technology and user experience. As the frontline of IT services, the IT Support Analyst ensures seamless technological interactions within the organization. This position involves a blend of technical prowess and customer service skills to support, manage, and optimize IT systems and services.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Providing IT support for users in the assigned sites
* Managing IT asset and stock
* Installing, configuring, and maintaining PCs, peripherals, and mobile devices
* Following-up on client questions and problems (hardware and software) until resolved
* Documenting issues and resolutions, producing reports when require
* Improving and maintaining customer satisfaction
* Contributing to testing and system quality compliance
* Following corporate policies and procedures
* And other duties and responsibilities as assigned


### **Requirements**



* Bachelor's Degree in the field of information technology, computer science, engineering or science is preferred
* Relevant certifications such as CCNA and A+ are preferred
* 1-3 years IT onsite support experience in pharmaceutical or life science industries is preferred.
* Good knowledge of Windows OS, MS Office, iOS
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work independently and solve problems based on guidelines and experience.
* Strong quality and customer service mindset.
* Ability and willingness to learn new technologies and skills.
* Knowledge of system and network administration, cloud-based applications are a plus.
* Experience in Office 365, Excel macro, Linux and/or Windows Shell scripting is a plus.
* Willing to work on a 3/4 day alternating shift. 11.5-12-hour shifts from 1:00 PM-1:00AM
