title: Merchant Service Relationship Manager
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Merchant Service Relationship Manager is responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with merchants, ensuring exceptional service and support, and driving the success of merchant accounts. This role involves managing key accounts, addressing merchant needs, and facilitating the growth of merchant services by providing strategic guidance and support.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Account Management:**
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with a portfolio of merchant accounts.
* Act as the primary point of contact for merchants, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and providing ongoing support.
* Understand each merchant’s business model and needs to deliver tailored solutions and recommendations.
* **Client Onboarding & Integration:**
* Oversee the onboarding process for new merchant accounts, ensuring a smooth transition and successful implementation of merchant services.
* Coordinate with internal teams to facilitate the integration of merchant services with the merchant’s existing systems and processes.
* **Performance Monitoring & Optimization:**
* Monitor merchant account performance, including transaction volumes, processing issues, and compliance.
* Provide insights and recommendations to merchants to optimize their use of merchant services and enhance their overall performance.
* Proactively identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling additional services or products that align with the merchant’s needs.
* **Customer Service & Support:**
* Deliver high-quality customer service by addressing merchant concerns promptly and professionally.
* Manage and resolve escalated issues or conflicts with merchants, ensuring satisfactory outcomes.
* Conduct regular check-ins and reviews with merchants to gauge satisfaction and address any ongoing needs.
* **Strategic Planning & Development:**
* Collaborate with merchants to develop and implement strategies that drive mutual growth and success.
* Analyze market trends and competitive landscape to provide strategic recommendations for improving merchant services.
* Participate in the development of new merchant service offerings and enhancements based on merchant feedback and industry trends.
* **Reporting & Documentation:**
* Prepare and present regular reports on merchant account performance, satisfaction, and key metrics to senior management.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of merchant interactions, agreements, and account details.
* Document and track key action items and follow-ups from client meetings and interactions.
* **Training & Education:**
* Educate merchants on the features and benefits of merchant services, ensuring they are aware of and utilize available tools and resources.
* Conduct training sessions or webinars for merchants to enhance their understanding and use of merchant services.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, or a related field. Advanced degree or relevant certification is a plus.
* Proven experience in account management, client relations, or a related role within the merchant services or financial services industry.
* Strong understanding of merchant services, payment processing, and related technologies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain positive relationships with merchants.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex issues and negotiations.
* Proficiency in CRM software and standard office applications (e.g., MS Office).
* Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines.

**Working Conditions:**

* Full-time position with standard office hours. Occasional travel may be required for client meetings or industry events.
* Office environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
**About us**

Wholeview Psychological Services, PLLC is a group psychotherapy practice, and Wholeview Direct is an OASAS-licensed treatment program that provides addiction services, both of which are based in New York, NY. This practice seeks Business Development Specialist to develop referral relationships. Our programs provide exceptional care for people struggling with addiction and mental health challenges and we are seeking team members who share our passion! At Wholeview you will work with an expert team of clinicians who are providing the highest quality care to patients who need it the most!

Our work environment includes:

* Flexible working hours
* Modern office setting

**Business Development Specialist**

**Job Description:**

Wholeview Direct is seeking a Business Development Specialist who will play a critical role in the success of this innovative startup substance use treatment center by developing and executing a comprehensive marketing plan. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in healthcare business development, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work independently to achieve revenue goals. The Business Development Specialist must be able to develop and maintain relationships with referral sources and have knowledge of substance use treatment and behavioral health services. The Business Development Specialist will be the primary point of contact for all potential referral sources and will work closely with the clinical team to ensure that patients receive high-quality care.

**Duties, Responsibilities & Essential Job Functions:**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive sales and marketing plan to achieve revenue goals and increase patient volume.
* Identify and prioritize target markets and develop strategies to attract and retain patients.
* Work directly with individuals as a treatment navigator to provide seamless transition of care.
* Establish and maintain relationships with referral sources, payers, and other key stakeholders in the community.
* Collaborate with clinical staff to ensure alignment between business development efforts and clinical operations.
* Analyze market trends to identify opportunities for growth and improvement, as well as compiling and analyzing competitive data within assigned geographical regions.
* Participate in networking events and conferences to build the center's reputation, increase visibility in the community, and drive business development.
* Prepare and deliver presentations to potential referral sources and payers to promote the center's services and create lasting relationships.
* Work closely with the billing and finance team to ensure accurate and timely reimbursement for services rendered.
* Submits timely CRM data, expense reports, annual strategic sales plans and quarterly strategic sales plan updates.
* Demonstrate knowledge/adherence to state and federal confidentiality regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree preferred in either Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in healthcare business development, preferably in substance use treatment or behavioral health; One year of experience in substance use treatment required.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects and priorities.
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
* Exemplary customer service/sales skills
* Understanding of healthcare reimbursement and payer contracting
* Ability to analyze market trends and competition to identify growth opportunities.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain relationships with referral sources, payers, and other key stakeholders in the community.
* Experience with sales and marketing in a healthcare setting
* Knowledge of substance use treatment and behavioral health services.
* Experience in fast-paced start-up environments
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software
* Valid driver’s license
* Willingness to be flexible in adjusting to new and changing situations.
* Demonstrates a strong desire to help clients, families, and all referrals in the transition to treatment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance

title: Faculty for Nursing College - Teterboro NJ
description:
**Information:**


Jersey College is an institution of higher learning with a vision to be nationally recognized through our dedication to excellence and innovation in nursing education while offering pathways for professional growth. Since our founding, Jersey College has graduated over 10,000 nurses.


Jersey College has positions available in our Nursing Program and is looking for Registered Nurses who have a desire and passion for teaching and will take both pride and ownership in the success of their students.

**Position:**


Registered Nurse Instructor

**Essential Functions:**

* Providing clinical instruction at long-term care, sub-acute, and acute clinical sites.
* Creating a clinical environment that fosters students academic growth and guides their professional development.
* Preparing student progress reports and grade reports
* Maintaining accurate and timely attendance records
* Evaluating student competence-based on program philosophy and objectives
* Implementing evaluation devices of student learning and clinical experience to measure progress and competency
* Attending faculty meetings
* Maintaining professional qualifications as a Registered Nurse Instructor through participation in continuing education programs, in-service training, and academic courses
* Perform other duties as required by the program director, program dean, or campus administration

**Skills & Abilities:**

* Ability to create and maintain relationships with students and co-workers
* Motivated, self-directed
* Team player
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to organize and prioritize workflow
* Ability to supervise students in the clinical environment
* Ability to deliver an effective lesson on the level of an RN or PN student
* Knowledgeable and experienced in the area of nursing specialty
* Relevant experience as a Registered Nurse that will contribute to student learning

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* BSN Required; MSN Preferred
* Valid State RN License Required
* Minimum of 3 years recent experience as a Registered Nurse
* Prior teaching experience is preferred but not required


NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY  

Jersey College does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, sex, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or military veteran status (Protected Status) and prohibits discrimination or harassment based on a Protected Status in any education program or activity that it operates, as required by the Age Discrimination Act, Section 504, Title II, Title III, Title VI, Title VII Title IX and their regulations, and other federal and state regulations and guidelines that prohibit discrimination, harassment, and retaliation against a Protected Status, including in admission and employment.  

  

Inquiries about the Age Discrimination Act, Section 504, Title II, Title III, Title VI, Title VII or Title IX may be referred to Jersey Colleges Title IX Compliance Coordinator and Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator, the U.S. Department of Educations Office for Civil Rights, or both. Jersey Colleges Title IX Compliance Coordinator and Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator is the Director of Institutional Effectiveness who may be contacted at the following: 546 U.S. Highway 46, Teterboro, NJ 07608; 201-489-5836; CivilRightsCoordinator@jerseycollege.edu ; or TitleIXcoordinator@jerseycollege.edu.  

  

Jersey Colleges nondiscrimination policy and grievance procedures can be located within the College Catalog (available at www.jerseycollege.edu/student-resources/college-catalog) under the sections entitled Civil Rights Policies and Title IX and VAWA Policies.

title: Elementary After School Program Teacher
description:
About VAC Enrichment:

VAC Enrichment is a leader in project-based enrichment, offering immersive learning experiences for students from PreK to 12th grade. Originating from New Jersey, we've broadened our reach across the nation, committed to making education engaging and inclusive for students and families of diverse backgrounds. Specializing in life skills and STEAM concepts, our custom-tailored curriculum has now reached hundreds of schools across the United States. As we continue to grow and evolve, our mission remains steadfast: to cultivate community-oriented education and propel the next generation of entrepreneurs and world-changers.

Position Overview:

At the core of our vision are our teachers. We seek a dedicated educator passionate about inspiring engagement and creating a vibrant learning atmosphere within our After School Enrichment Program.

The class we have available:

AI For Kids Grades 2-6 (Fridays 3:00 P.M.-4:00 P.M., 09/20/2024,09/27/2024,10/04/2024,10/11/2024,10/18/2024,11/01/2024,11/08/2024,11/15/2024,11/22/2024)

No need to have a background in the subject since we provide the curricula.

Ideal Candidate:

Is enthusiastic about engaging students.

Has a background in classroom teaching or has experience as a camp counselor.

Is patient and reliable.

Has the ability to find creative ways to engage students of all ages

Requirements:

Teach students during the day (specific dates and times will depend on class location).

Have reliable transportation to commute to the campus.

Adherence to school COVID protocols is mandatory.

Key Responsibilities:

Use our programs to deliver lessons effectively, emphasizing interactive learning.

Actively engage all students in the learning process.

Work collaboratively with teachers and parents.

Attend regular meetings to maintain alignment and uphold quality standards.

Skills & Experience:

Demonstrated experience in teaching or tutoring.

A robust understanding of teaching methodologies and best practices.

A readiness to adhere to the school's and VAC Enrichment's policies and procedures, including those pertaining to COVID.

Exemplary interpersonal skills.

When applying, include any extracurricular interests and leadership experiences in your resume.

A comprehensive background check is mandatory for all shortlisted candidates.

title: Professional Services Operations Manager
description:
Zift Solutions is a global software company that focuses entirely on channel success. We provide powerful channel-focused technology and deliver comprehensive cloud-based solutions for channel marketing, sales, and operations. But we’re not just a software provider – we provide strategic guidance for channel leaders, integration with existing tools and service options to support suppliers’ partner networks. We’re not just driving initiatives, we’re creating the future of channel management success and setting the benchmarks for industry.


The Professional Services Operations Manager is responsible for leading a cross-functional team that may include Business Analysts, Solution Engineers, Project Managers and Web Developers to drive discovery, implementation, configuration, and quality assurance for Zift Customers. Duties of these teams may include: on-boarding of Zift’s Customers; new projects for existing customers; platform configuration, and on-going platform management. This role is a combination of customer-facing and team leadership skillsets that requires outstanding communication, drive to create customer success , strong management skills, and ability to use multiple skills to solve customer needs. Professional Services Operations Manager will be expected to carry strong knowledge of the Zift Platform and Channel best practices, be comfortable presenting to and leading customer conversations

 **Functional Responsibilities:** *(list top ten primary duties)*

  

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Manage a team of 5-10 individuals across Business Analysis, Solution Engineering, Project Managers and Web Development practices and interface with role leads for each of those.
* Build a team, structure, processes and approach that supports professionalism and efficiency in service delivery, while maintaining high employee satisfaction, career opportunities and growth to the team. You are expected to foster a customer focused team, that understands Channel, the Zift platform and its configuration options and development tools. With Can-Do approach, your team will identify and build great solutions to customer needs.
* For implementations: Own end-to-end on-boarding of Zift’s Customers, driving fast time to value and high customer satisfaction.
* For existing customers: Own successful delivery of services requests for Zift Customers building program knowledge and best practices in platform usage that can drive high customer satisfaction.
* Drive best practices and accountability within the team including: managing workload and accountability for each direct report, identifying and managing towards agreed to KPIs as defined in conjunction with management team, improving process flow to ensure project excellence and efficiency.
* Collaborate closely with other parts of the company including: Support, to document, assist, and ensure supportability of the solution delivered; Product & Engineering, to contribute to product roadmap extensibility; Sales to enable upsell to existing customers and sales process with prospects; Customer Success Manager to promote customer success and satisfaction; Finance, to ensure accurate reporting, planning and profitability; and other Professional Services teams to ensure consistency, documentation, and handovers are executed cleanly.
* Consult with Senior Director, Professional Services to drive profitability from the group.
 **Required Qualifications:**

  

List any experience required for this position.

* BA or BS from accredited university or equivalent business experience in Business Analysis, Project Management, Solutions Engineering or Web Development
* 5 years’ experience in relevant technology management role
* Excellent customer management instincts and abilities.
* Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity and apply problem-solving skills with Can-Do approach.
* Technical familiarity with: Salesforce, SSO, HTML, CSS, and SQL
* Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment
 **Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Familiarity with Zift platforms: PRMAdmin, ZiftMarcom, ZiftONE
* 3 years of experience with channel management
* Good teamwork and leadership skills.
* Eager to drive customer success
* Good communication and collaboration skills with customers, vendors, and all levels within the organization. Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks.

title: Direct Support Professional (All Shifts)
description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring a **Full-Time, Part-Time and Per Diem Direct Support Professional's - DSP's (Weekday and Weekend shifts, 7am-3pm, 3pm-11pm, overnights 11pm-7am)** for our residential group home in Parsippany, NJ area (Lake Hiawatha, Boonton, Denville, Randolph, Jefferson Township, Wharton).

***Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.***

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & Sick Time

· Employee Referral Bonus Program

· 403b Retirement Plan

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

\\* Student Loan Forgiveness Plan

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

title: Head Golf Professional
description:
**Head Golf Professional,**



We're hiring a full-time Head Golf Operations Professional at Westchester Hills Golf Club!



At Troon, we believe our Associates are our greatest strength and competitive advantage. To be an effective coach, a leader needs to understand the impact they have on others – their influence. Operations management focuses on carefully managing the processes to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. We understand that leadership plays an important role running an operation compatible with the interests of members and their guests as well as club employees.



Ideal candidates are positive, able to work in small or large groups, and possess strong communication and interpersonal skills. As a Head Golf Operations Professional, you are a key member of the golf operations team at the property, managing all golf and golf-related activities at the facility. Previous golf industry experience is a requirement for the position.



Ideal candidates have flexible schedules and availability to work weekends and holidays, as needed. This includes competitive compensation ranging from $150,000 - $200,000.



Our team has made a conscious effort to ensure strong protocols are in place to keep you and our patrons safe, on and off the property, so you can focus on the golfer experience and camaraderie.



For more information on our open opportunities, apply today!


**Responsibilities**


* Plans, promotes, and directs all golf activities including management responsibilities on a daily basis
* Maintains an attractive and orderly appearance in the golf shop
* Supervises maintenance of golf cart fleet
* Provides golf lessons to facility patrons
* Interprets and imposes club policies, rules, and regulations
* Hires, trains, and supervises golf shop staff and outside services staff
* Conducts staff meetings with pro shop staff and outside services staff to ensure facility goals, objectives and standards are being met
* Creates annual budget plan for golf operations
* Manages inventory of merchandise in the pro shop and the outside service equipment
* Directs and promotes golf operation safety program
* Must have strong computer skills – Word, Excel, POS, and Tee Sheet Management
* Must have skill to exercise good independent judgment in assessing situations and making decisions
* Must have the ability to hire and develop a motivated golf staff
* Must be highly organized, efficient, and detail-oriented
* Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Must have strong customer/guest skills
* Must have solid supervisory and leadership skills


**Education and Experience Requirements**


* PGA Membership or PGA registered apprentice in good standing
* College Degree (PGM) preferred
* Must have 3-5 years golf industry experience
* Must have experience in golf operations management and a demonstrated ability to run a professional, efficient, high quality, service-oriented golf operation
* Must have knowledge of budgeting and expense management
* Experience in golf instruction
* Experience building player development programs
* Experience conducting golf outings/events


**Working Conditions**


* Regularly required to reach with arms and hands
* Often required to walk, stand, talk or hear, handle, feel or operate objects
* Must be able to lift and/or move up to 30lbs occasionally
* Occasionally be required to sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
* Specific vision abilities include close, distance, color, and peripheral vision, and depth perception
* Moderate exposure to extreme cold, heat, working outdoors, mechanical hazards and electrical hazards
* Exposure to pollens and dust
* Noise level is moderately quiet
* Work extended hours during golf and holiday season
* Work weekends and holidays


**About Troon**

Troon started as one facility in 1990 and has since grown to become the world’s largest professional club management company. We offer careers around the world at all levels of golf operations, opportunities for professional development, growth opportunities and a comprehensive benefits package. Our goal is to create extraordinary guest and member experiences through personalized service, consistency, and uncompromising attention to detail. For more information about the Troon Experience, please visit https://www.troon.com/.

title: Scientist Operations
description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.


The Position* A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.


Our team's collaborative and stimulating work culture will nourish you both professionally and personally, as you help develop innovative solutions that improve healthcare around the world.

**Job Summary**


In this position you will conduct process, manufacturing, equipment, and testing related non-conformance investigations. Manage non-conformance activities and/or laboratory experiments utilizing established and published procedures and technical and theoretical understanding while managing schedules and work flow to accomplish assigned objectives and product timelines.

**The Opportunity**
* **Weighing and Dispensing**: Perform weighing and dispensing of raw materials for process and internal orders, manage inventory and warehouse operations following SOPs and Batch records.
* **Coordination and Scheduling**: Coordinate dispensing activities across shifts to meet downstream production schedules and prepare production documents, including Production Printing and BOM calculations.
* **Compliance and Safety**: Perform production duties following work instructions, SOPs, OSHA safety regulations, and cGMPs; handle hazardous materials as required.
* **Documentation and Data Management**: Oversee lab supply inventory, generate purchase requisitions, input production and work-output data into SAP/LIMS, and maintain proper documentation.
* **Training and Resource Management**: Attend training, manage schedules and priorities based on business requirements, and serve as a resource to other departments for timely response and follow-ups.
* **Problem-Solving and Recommendations**: Troubleshoot and resolve problems creatively, make recommendations, and act independently to resolve issues, ensuring consistency with project timelines.
* **Physical Requirements**: Ability to perform repeat lifting of items up to 25lbs and maintain departmental stock rooms, labs, and buffer preparation as needed.
* **Who You Are**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
* 3 years of relevant industry experience or general laboratory experience.
* Ability to execute relevant laboratory experiments
* **Preferred**
* Strong writing skills. Experience with technical data and data analysis, root cause analysis experience preferred.
* *Relocation benefits are not available for this posting*


The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Branchburg, NJ is $29.13/hr - $54.08/hr. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.


Benefits


Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.


Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.

title: Pastry Chef - Donut & Cupcake Decorator
description:
Job Description: Pastry Chef - Donut & Cupcake Decorator\\*\\*

Location: Holey Cream - 1460 Lexington Avenue

Job Type: Full-Time

Holey Cream is a vibrant and innovative bakery known for our delicious and artfully crafted pastries. We pride ourselves on creativity, quality, and delivering a delightful experience to our customers. We’re looking for a talented Pastry Chef to join our team and bring a fresh touch to our donut and brownie flavors and decorations.

Role Overview:

As a Pastry Chef specializing in donut decoration and flavor profiles, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and delectable designs that captivate our customers. Your role will involve crafting innovative and imaginative decorations that reflect current trends while also setting new standards in the pastry world.

Key Responsibilities:

- Design & Decoration:\\*\\* Develop and implement unique and creative designs for donuts and cupcakes, ensuring each item is visually appealing and aligns with our brand’s aesthetic.

- Ingredient Handling:\\*\\* Work with a variety of ingredients, colors, and textures to produce intricate decorations and designs.

- Innovation:\\*\\* Stay current with industry trends and techniques, introducing new and exciting decoration ideas to keep our offerings fresh and engaging.

- Collaboration:\\*\\* Work closely with the team to ensure cohesive execution of design and flavor.

- Quality Control:\\*\\* Maintain high standards of cleanliness and food safety, ensuring that all decorated items meet our quality and presentation standards.

- Customer Interaction:\\*\\* Working the counter and engaging with customers to gather feedback and incorporate their preferences into your designs.

Qualifications:

- Proven experience as a Pastry Chef or in a similar role with a strong portfolio showcasing your decoration skills.

- Expertise in decorating techniques for donuts and cupcakes, including piping, glazing, and fondant work.

- Creativity and a keen eye for detail, with the ability to design and execute intricate decorations.

- Strong understanding of current pastry trends and the ability to innovate within the craft.

- Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

- Passion for baking and a commitment to delivering exceptional quality and presentation.

Why Join Us?

- Opportunity to showcase your creativity and make an impact with innovative designs.

- Collaborative and supportive team environment.

- Competitive salary and benefits.

- Room for professional growth and development.

If you’re a talented and imaginative Pastry Chef with a flair for decorating donuts and cupcakes, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and be a part of our exciting journey to delight and inspire our customers with every bite!

How to Apply:

Send your resume, a cover letter detailing your experience and passion for pastry decoration. We look forward to seeing how you can bring your creative touch to our bakery!

title: Brand Buyer
description:
Our Story
Simply put, we make great jeans and all the cool stuff you wear with them. And, beyond our devotion to premium denim, we believe in putting people and planet first in everything we do from our commitment to sustainable production to our focus on broadening opportunity and building belonging.  

Whether you’re taking the first step in your career or are looking for an exciting new opportunity, we have a wide array of challenging and creative roles for you. We foster a collaborative, community-driven and innovative environment in our stores, home office, and distribution and call centers. Want in?
Our dedication to Diversity, Equity, Belonging & Sustainability has been celebrated with industry recognition, reflecting our commitment to fostering an inclusive and sustainable workplace.
Madewell is searching for a Brand Buyer to create robust and exciting 3rd party branded product assortment that both amplifies and complements the Madewell assortment. This candidate will deliver a comprehensive branded strategy via collaborations, owned 3rd party inventory and assortments from 3rd party brands via marketplace. They intuitively react to market trends and develop action plans that drive category specific growth and increased profitability.  

  

Merchandising* Develop a compelling assortment, based on DTC strategies that meet/exceed sales volume and profits
* Expand product line to enhance appeal to target market.
* Analyze velocity reports and respond to current trends as appropriate
* Ensure key fashion trends are well represented in the assortment.
* Facilitate finalizations to plan and merchandise product assortments for all channel
* Shop market, both domestic and international, to fill voids, check on current trends and identify key chase opportunities
* Ability to distort classifications to ensure positioning within the market
* Collaborate on new design collaborations with brand creative and design
* Manage artist relationships
* Maintain clear vision of store and direct customer and her needs
* Work with Merchandising team to develop strong story lines for the website, emails and store presentations

  

Organization & Analysis* Weekly: Analyze sales and inventory flow.
* Monthly: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop new and evolving strategies for go forward.
* Post Season: Conduct in-season and post-season analyses to better evaluate and control the business.
* Clearly communicate current trends, opportunities, successes, and failures at best/worst meetings.
* Maintain branded merchandising calendar
* Manage daily sample management and collection of product information for style-outs, meetings, and photo shoots

  

Product Information* Oversee Product Information prior to Turnover and develop compelling story lines to increase productivity for all channels.
* Shop competition and inspirational stores. Stay connected to current industry trends, fashion shows, design fairs, and other influential cultural events.

  

Role Qualifications* Creative problem solving.
* Entrepreneurial mentality, self motivated.
* Demonstrated ability to lead a business.
* High taste level
* Be able to own, articulate, and execute a clear vision.
* 7+ years buying experience required.


#LI-Hybrid

title: Veterinary Technician - Neurology - Part-time
description:
**BluePearl Specialty + Emergency Pet Hospital is hiring an experienced Neurology Veterinary****Technician to work on Mondays at our Midtown, NY location****.**

**Schedule**: Mondays 8am-6pm. Possible on-call responsibilities for emergency surgeries.

**Pay:** $26.50 - $51.00 / hour

***This pay band is a starting point and is dependent on experience and advancement through CareerTrax leveling system****.*  

  

**\\*\\* Candidates with VTS credentialing are eligible for compensation commensurate with experience\\*\\***

  

We also offer competitive shift differential pay for eligible hours worked for nights and weekends.

* Shift differentials are based on a 4-hour minimum. For example:
* Mon – Fri: 6pm to 8am = $4.50 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 6pm to 8am = $6.00 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 8am to 6pm = $4.50 Shift Differential

We strive to provide state-of-the-art services to our patients and clients. We are very proactive in supporting our technician team to advance their careers. We have many specialized technicians in Anesthesia, Internal Medicine, and Emergency/Critical Care. Applicants should have a strong knowledge base, motivation to learn, and ambition to work in a fast-paced team environment.

 **As a Neurology Veterinary****Technician****, you will:**

* Set up constant rate infusions (CRI).
* Calculates all medical math including advanced and CRI (mcg/mg, %/mg, etc).
* Induce, monitor and recover anesthesia
* Set up for MRI and CT procedures.
* Discharge neuro patients from the hospital, including basic client education such as manual bladder expression, sling walking, range of motion, etc..Provide nursing care to stable patients according to hospital standards of care and core values
* Perform call backs and refill medications
* Client education, gathering histories and communicating that to the Clinician
* Perform physical exam; accurately count heart, pulse rate, capillary refill time, mucous membranes, temperature, respiratory rate and effort.
* Understand normal vital parameters
* Comfortable with IVC placement and venipuncture
* Operate all brands of intravenous fluid pumps and can troubleshoot errors.
* Restrain patients during consults and during diagnostics
 **Why BluePearl?**

* Our passion is pets. We offer Trupanion pet insurance and discounts to our associates for pet treatments, procedures, and food.
* We encourage you to grow with us. Our technicians are leveled by their skillset and move up in level as they gain more skills and experience. We are focused on developing our associates into leaders through talent development programs and leadership workshops. As a member of Mars Veterinary Health, our associates have endless opportunities to advance in his/her career.
* In order to transform and lead the industry through innovative quality medicine and care, we understand the importance of continuous learning. We offer annual continuing education allowance, free continuing education sessions, our own BluePearl University for training, and our clinicians have access to over 2,000 medical journals.
* A regional licensed social worker who can provide guidance, advice, and tips/tricks on how to maintain a healthy lifestyle while working in a fast-paced emergency and specialty care environment.
* **Lyra;** Access to 12 mental health care sessions annually at no charge to you, and other well-being resources through Lyra- an online mental health support platform
* We promote a family-like culture in our hospitals. We are all in this together. We believe in working together to lead the industry by enriching lives through remarkable care for pets.

  

Our Continuing Education Plan includes $500/year reimbursement for CVT and $750/year for VTS. The Continuing Education allowance can roll over up to $1,500 for CVT and VTS associates. Non-Credentialed, full-time Paraprofessionals are eligible for an annual CE stipend of $150. Full-time CVT associates also receive 8 hours of CE paid hours each year. Full-time VTS associates receive 12 hours of CE paid each year. Paid CE hours can be carried over year to year up to a maximum of 24 hours. Newly hired associates will receive a pro-rated amount of any CE benefit for which they are eligible.

* Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Parental Leave Benefits
* Health, dental, vision, and life insurance options
* Paid Time Off and Floating Holiday Plans
* Health Savings Account
* Flexible Savings Account
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Annual Scrub Allowance: full-time associates receive $200/year in BluePearl store credit.
* Referral Bonus Program
* State licensure reimbursements
* VTNE reimbursements
* Additional VTS benefits – pursuing & established VTS technicians.
### ***BluePearl is committed to a diverse work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. We are an equal opportunity******employer******and each applicant will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, sexual or affectional preference, or gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized******as a result of******such a request. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.***

title: Community Outreach Coordinator
description:
SOFT's client located in **South Plainfield, NJ** is looking for a Community Outreach Coordinator for a long term contract assignment.  
The **Community Outreach Coordinator works closely with various project teams in support of capital projects associated with Projects & Construction (P&C) and Gas Construction in order to develop and implement communications and outreach strategies that support the strategic objectives of these organizations.**

The focus of this position will be to initiate, develop and execute proactive outreach, marketing communications and media/social media relations plans that effectively promote P&C and GSMP initiatives. This includes collaborating with internal project teams and business partners to gather requirements and develop effective communications strategies and supporting a highly structured effort to cascade and reinforce key messages with the right tools and most effective communication channels for each audience segment, specifically the residential and business community. The Public Affairs Specialist will support Regional Public Affairs Managers (RPAs) in monitoring and developing local policy proposals, such as ordinances. Door to door canvassing to share construction updates to residential and business customers. Responding to project hotlines to address customer questions and concerns. Primary audiences include key business leaders, policy makers and influential members of the community in addition to local, county and state elected officials. This position will also align with RPAs representing the company at town hall, zoning board, and planning board meetings, etc. to gain necessary project approvals.  
This position is also involved with the facilitation and development of an outreach strategy for each company project. This includes development of a route profile designed to identify key information about a project host community with an emphasis on identifying any potential opposition. This position is also responsible for making recommendations to include in the development of mitigation plans to insure the project’s success.

Required

* **Bachelor’s Degree and** **2 years of experience in public affairs, community outreach, public relations, or related experience****, OR in lieu of a Bachelor’s Degree, 3 years of experience in public affairs, community outreach, public relations or related experience**

**• Strong customer focus**  
**• Strong customer relations skills and ability to work with the public**

* Strong analytical, organizational, communication and presentation skills
* Awareness of social media and its application to business communication
* Demonstrated experience writing and editing
* **Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel**

title: Merchant Service Customer Services Rep
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Merchant Service Customer Service Representative is responsible for providing exceptional support to merchants utilizing the company’s services. This role involves handling inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring a positive experience for merchants. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, a customer-focused mindset, and a solid understanding of merchant services and payment processing.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Customer Support:**

1. Serve as the primary point of contact for merchants, addressing inquiries related to their accounts, transactions, and services.

2. Resolve issues efficiently and effectively, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.

3. Provide guidance and support on using merchant services and payment processing systems.

**Issue Resolution:**

1. Handle and troubleshoot technical issues or service disruptions related to merchant accounts or payment processing.

2. Work closely with technical support and other internal teams to address and resolve complex problems.

3. Follow up with merchants to ensure issues are resolved and to verify their satisfaction.

**Account Management:**

1. Assist merchants with account setup, maintenance, and updates, including changes to account information or service options.

2. Process requests for account modifications, refunds, or transaction disputes in accordance with company policies.

3. Ensure accurate and timely documentation of all interactions and transactions.

**Product Knowledge:**

1. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the company’s products, services, and industry trends.

2. Educate merchants on the features and benefits of available services and any new product offerings.

3. Provide merchants with information on best practices for optimizing their use of merchant services.

**Customer Feedback:**

1. Collect and document feedback from merchants to identify areas for improvement and enhance service delivery.

2. Report recurring issues or trends to management for further analysis and resolution.

3. Participate in customer satisfaction surveys and assist in implementing improvement initiatives.

**Compliance & Documentation:**

1. Adhere to company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements in all customer interactions.

2. Maintain accurate and detailed records of customer interactions, issues, and resolutions.

3. Ensure all documentation is handled securely and in compliance with data protection regulations.

**Team Collaboration:**

1. Work closely with other customer service representatives, sales teams, and technical support to ensure seamless service delivery.

2. Participate in team meetings and contribute to the development of customer service best practices.

3. Share knowledge and expertise with colleagues to support continuous improvement and team success.

**Qualifications:**

High school diploma or equivalent required. Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or a related field is a plus.

Previous experience in a customer service role, preferably within the financial services or merchant services industry.

Strong understanding of payment processing systems and merchant services.

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with a focus on customer service.

Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Proficiency in customer service software, CRM systems, and standard office applications (e.g., MS Office).

**Working Conditions:**

Full-time position with standard office hours. Some flexibility may be required based on business needs.

Office environment.

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
**Pharmacy Technician (Liaison)**  

**Stamford Health**  

**Stamford, CT**



CPS Solutions is seeking a highly motivated customer service-oriented **Pharmacy Technician (Liaison)** professional who wants to elevate their career to the next level in the specialty pharmacy arena. Join a growing team at our **CPS Solutions /** **Stamford Health** location in **Stamford, CT**. This role will provide outstanding customer service, work alongside clinical pharmacists, interact with physicians and healthcare professionals, contact insurance companies and help find payment assistance programs for our patients.



Pay rate: $21-$23 per hour based DOE, plus bonus


**Responsibilities**
  

Greeting patients upon arrival to the clinic  

Explaining the benefits of our specialty pharmacy and successfully enrolling patients into the program  

Performing all insurance benefit investigations, prior authorization, claim rejects, overrides, etc.  

Working with patients to find financial aid (grants, manufacture programs, discount cards, etc.) to ensure they have access to the medications they need  

Data/order entry and verification of patient information  

Providing direct support to enrolled patients to ensure that they are supported throughout their therapy regimen and achieve their intended outcome. This includes:  

 Conducting outbound phone calls for patient support, adherence checks and refill reminders  

 Appropriately triaging any clinical questions to the appropriate clinician (pharmacist, nurse or provider)  

 Participating in conference and workshops to help promote CPS


**Qualifications**
  

High school diploma or equivalent  

Experience as a pharmacy liaison/technician highly preferred  

Registered, or the ability to become registered, as a pharmacy technician in the State of **Connecticut**  

Experience interacting with physicians, nurses and other healthcare professionals (preferably in a medical clinic)  

Knowledge of benefit investigations, prior authorization support and patient financial assistance work a plus  

Strong people skills and the ability to work with teams across various business units  

Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, EMR systems (EPIC, Cerner or Meditech) and dispensing systems (QS1, RX30 or Computer Rx) highly preferred  

Provide a high level of customer service, while always upholding CPS standards


**And bonus points if you have**
  

Experience in a health systems specialty pharmacy as an in-clinic technician  

Experience working with various disease states


**Here’s what we’d like to offer you**  

 Competitive compensation including a bonus opportunity  

Full range of benefits, medical, dental, vision, 401K with company match, long and short-term disability, life insurance, PTO, paid sick time, paid holidays and more!


**Hospital Requirements (may be required)**  

(PPD) TB Skin Test – proof of negative TB skin test within the last 12 months  

(MMR) Measles, Mumps and Rubella or a blood titer proving immunity  

Varicella – (2) documented doses or a blood titer proving immunity  

Hep B3 Series  

(Flu) Influenza – required for hire between October 1st and April 30th  

COVID vaccine


**Benefits:**All employees enjoy a competitive salary, eligibility to participate in the 401K savings plan with a match. Full-time employees are also eligible for a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance, time-off plan, company paid short and long-term disability, basic and supplemental life insurance, medical flex and dependent care accounts and more.


**CPS Solutions, LLC Requirements:**All employment offers are contingent upon successfully passing a pre-employment (post-offer) background check, drug test and signed onboarding documents. Additionally, you may be required to provide medical records or have additional medical examinations/background checks that are a specific requirement of the location or position in which you are hired. Due to the healthcare requirements of the location where you will work and the clients we support, this may include a COVID vaccine. This applied to internal transfers and status changes for internal CPS Solutions, LLC team members. CPS Solutions, LLC is also committed to a safe and drug free workplace.


**About CPS Solutions, LLC:**Founded nearly 50 years ago and employing over 2,500 clinical, regulatory and operational pharmacy professionals, CPS Solutions, LLC, is one of the nation’s largest providers of pharmacy services to more than 800 hospitals and healthcare facilities nationwide. CPS Solutions, LLC helps clients tackle a variety of complex issues, such as operational efficiency, rising drug cots, regulatory and compliance, 340B and specialty pharmacy strategy. CPS Solutions, LLC helps healthcare leaders drive best in class pharmacy operations through skill, expertise and proprietary technologies. For more information visit: https://www.cps.com.


*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any qualified employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age national origin, ancestry, religious creed, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, mental or physical disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.*

title: Caregiver/CSAT Worker
description:
The Community Self-Advocacy Training and Support service worker provides children with developmental, physical and/or behavioral health disabilities with activities that will assist them to integrate in community events. The focus is to improve the child/youth’s ability to gain from the community experience and enables the child/youth’s environment to be cognizant, accommodative, and sensitive to their disabilities and/or health issues. The worker also assists the family /caregiver to participate in activities with the child/youth to promote healthy relationships and success in treatment.

High school diploma or high school equivalency required.1-year experience working with children/youth in foster care or in a Children’s Mental Health Program or related human service experience required.

title: Head Teacher Early LIFE
company: Lutheran Social Services of New York
description:
POSITION: Lead Teacher Early LIFE Center


REPORTS TO: Director of Early LIFE Center


CLASSIFICATION: Full Time


EXEMPT/NONEXEMPT: Exempt


SALARY: $34,163 to $68,652/yr (commensurate with license and/or degree)


================================================================


GENERAL DESCRIPTION: The Lead Teacher is responsible for the academic, instructional, remedial, behavioral and adaptive needs of all their children in an assigned age level classroom, as part of LSSNYs early childhood program. The teacher must have strong management skills and techniques that can foster the pre-school classroom instructional process and will supervise the Assistant Teachers/Aides/Floaters and Volunteers/Interns working in the classroom. The teacher must have a functional understanding and ability to meet all reporting mandates as determined by various governmental agencies. The teacher must work cooperatively with fellow staff, parents, guardians, outside agencies and the funders to better serve our children.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Represent Lutheran Social Service of New Yorks mission, values, ethics, and upholds agency Code of Conduct at all times.
* Oversee and provide classroom activities and instruction tailored to meet the childrens overall developmental goals.
* Develop curricula and enrichment activities that will encourage student interest and participation
* Follow schedule as developed collaboratively with the Educational coordinator
* Prepare daily lesson plans for all instructional periods
* Keep accurate records of individual student progress throughout the school year
* Maintain an appropriate physical environment in the classroom or work area
* Maintain appropriate safety measures to insure the protection of the children and staff
* Provide enrichment activities for the parents and guardians of our children at specially designated events that may be outside the regular center hours or on non-center days
* Make suggestions to the Director of Pre-school to further enrich the center's offerings
* Assist in other duties as assigned by the Center Director, including assisting with food service, if needed
* May be required to support at other locations if/when needed.


SUPERVISES:

* Children
* Assistant Teachers, Teachers Aides/Floater
* Volunteers or Interns


EDUCATION:


+ Certification preferred, but must be study plan eligible on a pathway towards NYS certification


+ To be study plan eligible, you must:

* Be enrolled in BA/S program in Education or ECE with 90 completed college credits
* OR have a BA in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, Child Psychology, Elementary Education (N-6), Special Education (B-2),
* OR General Education (with 12 credits in Early Childhood Education) while enrolled in a MS program pursuing Early Childhood Education or Students with Disabilities (Birth through 2) or Childhood Education (covering through grade 6)
* OR a MS in ECE or Childhood Education while consistently taking certification exams until passed and certification acquired


EXPERIENCE:


+ Minimum of 1 year experience in a childcare setting or working with children


SKILLS & ABILITIES:


+ Demonstrated ability to provide instruction for the Early Childhood age level population


+ Demonstrated ability to provide effective management skills and techniques for an Early Childhood age level population


+ Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with the site director administration, fellow teachers, service staff, parents and guardians


+ Demonstrated ability to write appropriate and targeted student progress reports


+ Demonstrated ability to adapt your area of expertise to meet student learning needs


+ Demonstrated ability to work with parents and other community members to meet student learning needs

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

**Location:** Soho Warehouse

**Status:** Seasonal

**Comp:** $17/hr

**Position Summary:** The KITH Warehouse Associate is a key part of the product/merchandise cycle. They receive all product at the Warehouse and diligently prepare it for the stores or ecommerce channels. Working under the guidance of the Warehouse Leadership Team, they work to maintain an operationally efficient process throughout the entire product flow cycle. From receiving and preparing new product, to transferring the product to its assigned store, the Warehouse Associate works alongside a collaborative team to ensure all product is accurately accounted for and all Standard Operating Procedures are followed. The Warehouse Associate supports the Store & E-Commerce channels by fulfilling any orders, as required by the business.

*This position is seasonal (August-November) with the possibility of becoming permanent, strictly based off the availability of a permanent position as well as the performance of the employee, throughout their tenure.* 

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Partner with Warehouse Leadership to execute tasks that streamline the product cycle.
* Conduct Physical Inventories and/or cycle counts as assigned by Management or as the business requires.
* Follow Standard Operating Procedures to ensure product is readily available.
* Ensure assigned tasks are completed in an efficient and accurate manner.
* Consistently work with Management to ensure stores or clients are receiving product in a timely manner.
* Assist Management in maintaining a clean and safe workspace, by completing traditional cleaning tasks such as but not limited to, sweeping, breaking down boxes, and collecting/disposing of garbage.
* Executing any necessary assigned tasks before or after regular Warehouse operating hours.
* Ensure adherence to all company policy and procedures.

**Special Projects:**

* Participate and assist stores in Physical Inventories as required by the business.
* Assist Merchandising team during visual initiatives as required by the business.
* Provide support to Store teams during events, big product launches or overall heavy business days.
* Support the E-Commerce team in fulfilling or processing any orders/returns, as required by the business.

**REQUIREMENTS**

**Availability:**

* Open & flexible availability, including but not limited to evenings, overnights, and weekends as well as Holidays.

**Experience:**

* 6+ Months in a retail operations position.
* 6+ Months in a retail/apparel environment is a plus.
* 6+ Months in a Warehouse environment is a plus.

**Skills/Abilities:**

* Standing/Walking for prolonged periods of time
* Lifting or moving up to 50 pounds
* Bending, twisting as well as climbing of ladders and other physical tasks related to standard retail operations
* Efficient time management skills
* Ability to efficiently multi-task
* Efficient communication with customers, peers, or Direct-Reports

**WHO YOU ARE**

**Professional Characteristics:**

* Team-Player
* Supportive
* Self-starter
* Goal oriented

**Personal Characteristics:**

* Organized
* Communicative
* Reliable & trustworthy

**WHO WE ARE**

Established in 2011, Kith is a leading lifestyle brand and progressive retail concept that’s celebrated globally for its ability to tell stories, evoke nostalgia, and connect product to the passion it’s woven with. Now in its eleventh year of business, Kith has in-house apparel lines for men, women and children, an ice cream parlor in every flagship, a full-service restaurant, and a retail footprint in three continents.

Born and raised in Queens, New York, Kith Founder Ronnie Fieg rose the ranks from 13-year-old stock boy at footwear franchise David Z. to the company’s chief buyer, earning him a profound understanding of the retail landscape and a network of powerful brand relationships. As the brand’s CEO and Creative Director, Fieg is known for his ability to create premium products and deliver unparalleled experiences, with a personal philosophy of giving the consumer more than what they pay for. Using Kith as a vehicle, Fieg has applied his signature lens to an impressive list of collaborators, including Coca-Cola, Nike, Versace, BMW, and many others.

*KITH is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Are you 18 years of age or older?
* Are you able to lift up to 25 pounds?
* Are you capable of reasonably performing the physical duties of the job up to and including but not limited to: Standing, walking, climbing stairs/ladders/step stools, bending, twisting, reaching, holding and carrying product and/or boxes?

Experience:

* Stocking: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$500 FOR PART TIME, $1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group homes in Bergen County (Hackensack, Bogota, Englewood).

**Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & Sick Time

· Employee Referral Bonus Program

· 403b Retirement Plan

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.88 - $19.88 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Are you vaccinated for COVID-19? Have you received a booster?
* What days and shifts are you available to work?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License in good standing (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Residential Group Home Manager
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated Group Home Manager with expertise in working with adult clients with developmental disabilities to oversee operations of 2 medical group homes. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing medical group homes and ensuring resident rights and quality care. **Must have at least 1 year of experience supervising a group home.**

Duties:

- Supervise and manage a team of staff members who provide care and support to individuals with developmental disabilities.  
- Ensure that all residents receive high-quality care and support in accordance with their individual needs and preferences.  
- Develop and implement individualized care plans for each resident, in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team.  
- Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of care plans, making adjustments as necessary to ensure optimal outcomes for residents.  
- Provide leadership and guidance to staff members, promoting a positive work environment and fostering professional growth.  
- Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and guidelines related to resident rights, safety, and quality of care.  
- Collaborate with external healthcare professionals, such as nurses or therapists, to coordinate medical care for residents.  
- Maintain accurate documentation and records related to resident care, staff performance, and operational activities.

Skills:

- Strong leadership skills with the ability to effectively manage a team of employees.  
- Knowledge of working with people with developmental disabilities and an understanding of their unique needs.  
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively interact with residents, families, and staff members.

Please note that this is a general description of duties and skills for a Group Manager position. The specific responsibilities may vary depending on the organization's size, type of facility, and other factors.

Qualifications  
- Management experience in a residential medical group settings  
- Supervisory background in home & community care  
- Proficiency in operations management within residential group homes  
- Demonstrated leadership skills in overseeing staff and residents  
- Familiarity with care plans and residents' rights  
- Ability to work with individuals with developmental disabilities

title: Strategy Implementation Leader
description:
Summary of Job

Develop strategy in concert with key business stakeholders across EmblemHealth enterprise. Translate strategy into defined tactics, program priorities, and timelines, and ensure alignment and attainment of business unit strategic plans to turn strategy into reality. Build and leverage relationships to provide innovative solutions to complex business problems. Lead a strategically oriented project portfolio and/or program (a group of projects), while monitoring internal and/or external dependencies. Ensure projects are properly funded and staffed, have/maintain executive sponsorship, and key stakeholders  

are continuously engaged and aware of projects status and critical issues. Serve as the subject matter expert in Project and Portfolio Management methodology and best practices. Partner with the Executive Sponsors, business owners, and when necessary, the IT organization. Provide guidance and oversight on mission-critical projects to meet business deadlines; develop mitigation strategies as warranted; and work with business on monitoring financial performance of funded projects. Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties involved. Uphold the enterprise’s code of ethics and business conduct.  

  

Responsibilities:
* Oversee and support multiple, complex projects based on the overall enterprise strategy and resource capabilities.
* Track and manage all project action items to timely resolution.
* Contribute to the development, coordination and administration of strategic initiatives in support of enterprise objectives and goals. Assist in annual Project Portfolio planning, scoping and prioritization.
* Oversee centralized services such as project definition, planning, scheduling, pricing, risk assessment and tracking to effectively monitor the committed time, scope and budget of the projects.
* Serve as primary liaison to Executive Sponsors/Senior leaders in support of attaining desired project outcomes.
* Actively lead in project status meetings; may lead on project Steering Committees of mission critical projects.
* Support department executive in executing business strategy, enhance organizational culture, team development and process improvement.
* Reprioritize work as business and strategy needs dictate and facilitate discussions at all levels of the organization.
* Partner with IT as needed for technical workstream as part of overall project. This can include submitting PPMs for the business and tracking status to ensure meeting business deadlines.
* Provide oversight of the relationships between the entire project team including external vendors and suppliers that are engaged with the project.
* Manage project completion postmortem to ensure gathering of Lessons Learned and call outs for future projects.
* Establish and implement strategic project management documentation and methodologies including policies, standards, procedures, and necessary technologies.
* Provide active consultation and mentoring to the project management community throughout the project lifecycle and monitor adherence to PM standards and methodology. Identify, provide direction, and/or remediate, when possible, any major project management risks that would affect expected performance of the portfolio.
* Drive decision making regarding utilization of project resources.
* Identify critical resource needs and negotiate with functional resource managers to secure allocation to the project and to ensure projects progress in accordance with agreed upon deliverables.


Qualifications:
* Bachelors’ Degree (Required); Masters’ Degree or MBA (Preferred)
* PMI Certification - Project Management Professional (PMP) (Preferred)
* 10 – 15+ years’ professional business experience, preferably in the Healthcare Payer business (Required)
* Minimum 10 years’ experience managing large and highly complex Healthcare Payer projects (Required)
* 3+ years’ experience in Management Consulting (Preferred)
* Ability to assess and develop risk mitigation strategy recommendations (Required)
* Strong understanding of project related business case development and cost benefit analysis (Required)
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with staff up to and including leadership (Required)
* Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) with all types/levels of audiences (Required)
* Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office tools - Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook (Required)


Additional Information


* Job Type: Standard
* Schedule: Full-time
* Employee Status: Regular
* Requisition ID: 1000001658
* Hiring Range: $105,000-$195,000
